articles.description: Follow live text updates as England face West Indies in the second of three one-day internationals in Antigua.
articles.title: England bowl first against West Indies in second ODI

articles.description: Follow BBC Radio 5 Live commentary and live text from six Premier League games including Man Utd against Chelsea and Man City visiting Aston Villa.
articles.title: Premier League: Six games including Man Utd v Chelsea & Aston Villa v Man City

articles.description: In 1951, a celebratory trophy parade is said to have crossed paths with a funeral procession. Whether true or not, their meeting hangs over Mayo's Gaelic football team.
articles.title: Cursed? The story of the 72-year-old hex that haunts Mayo

articles.description: England produce a convincing performance to beat India by 38 runs in the opening game of their T20 series.
articles.title: England win T20 series opener against India

articles.description: Golf's rule makers choose to limit the distance the ball can be hit in decision that affects professionals and amateurs, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: 'New ball rules will hit golfers at every level'

articles.description: Football Association chair Debbie Hewitt told a Fifa committee she felt 'uncomfortable' at the behaviour of Spanish Football Federation president Luis Rubiales at Women's World Cup final.
articles.title: FA chair 'uncomfortable' with Rubiales' behaviour

articles.description: Manchester United winger Antony criticises former players of the club for not asking about his feelings.
articles.title: 'Ex-Man Utd players never ask if I'm OK' - Antony

articles.description: Bangladesh batter Mushfiqur Rahim becomes only the second Test batter in history to be dismissed for obstructing the field.
articles.title: Mushfiqur given out for obstructing field

articles.description: All 10 Formula 1 teams have issued statements denying they have made any complaints about the behaviour of Toto and Susie Wolff.
articles.title: F1 teams deny complaining about Toto & Susie Wolff

articles.description: LeBron James scores 31 points as the Los Angeles Lakers beat the Phoenix Suns 106-103 in a thriller to reach the semi-finals of the NBA's inaugural In-Season Tournament.
articles.title: James stars as Lakers beat Suns to reach semis
